title: Four dead and five injured after shooting at bar in Kansas
text:
Four people were killed in an overnight shooting at a bar in Kansas City, Kansas, according to police.

(Picture: KKTV)

Four people have been shot and a further five injured after a man walked into a bar and opened fire, police have said.

At this stage it is unclear if the shooter is dead or remains at large after the shooting in the Tequila KC bar in Kansas, US, today.

No official description of the killer has been released as yet although one journalist local to the area has reported him to be of Hispanic descent.

Kansas City police were notified of the shooting at 1.27 am local time, the force said.

Police spokesman Thomas Tomasic told CNN that officers arrived to find four people dead inside the bar.

Police said the suspect(s) entered the bar and started shooting (Picture: KKTV)

A further five were taken to hospital and are said to be in stable conditions.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Tomasic said: ‘We do not have a good enough description yet, to put anything out for a suspect, or suspects, we don’t even know how many.’

Police remain at the Central Avenue bar looking for surveillance video of the area as they await for a search warrant to re-enter the bar having cleared it.

On scene near 10th and Central where officers responded to a shooting. 9 total people were shot 4 of the 9 are dead. We are told the suspect entered the bar Tequila KC and started shooting.

Police are still looking for the suspect. @41actionnews pic.twitter.com/5kwX69IkVF — Nick Starling (@NickStarlingTV) October 6, 2019

Four dead five injured I'm a shooting at a bar at 10th and Central I'm KCK. Action 41 News is the only local media on the scene. A live report coming up at 6am. pic.twitter.com/LQo2kl7caa — Mark Kachelmeier (@KSHB_Photo) October 6, 2019

This is a developing story.

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
